citations.narrative:
The licensee is lacking an updated inventory and complete acquisition and disposition records for all animals housed on
site. Inventory and associated records allow Animal Care officials to track movement and whereabouts of the animals.
Especially since some animals are sent away on loan each year to other facilities, this information is important to knowing
the location and identification of animals that are away. A current inventory with all required information must be
maintained for animals on hand, any offspring born on premises, and animals sold, transferred, or dead.
***Correct by 1-22-24.

The licensee is lacking a written contingency plan that was required to be in place by July 5, 2022. Exhibitors must
develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing
and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. The contingency plan must identify emergency
situations one could reasonable expect in the area, outline specific tasks to be carried out, identify a chain or command,
and address how response and recovery will be handled. Not having a written plan in place could cause delay of critical
help for the for the animals and could negatively affect their health and well-being in the case of an emergency or
disaster.
***Correct by 1-22-24.

citations.desc: Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being.
citations.narrative:
The licensee is missing a completed and approved environmental enrichment plan for the birds on premises. They have a
number of varieties of species of poultry, as well as exotics, and indoor pet birds. Social grouping is being considered and
proper environmental enrichment is being provided to the birds, but the facility lacks a written plan that is approved by the
attending veterinarian. The plan should include all required components including: social grouping, environmental
enrichment, special considerations, restraint devices and exemptions. A species appropriate plan for environmental
enhancement is necessary to promote the psychological well-being of birds.
***Correct by 1-22-24
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.75(b)(1) 
   
Records: Dealers and exhibitors. 
The licensee is lacking an updated inventory and complete acquisition and disposition records for all animals housed on 
site. Inventory and associated records allow Animal Care officials to track movement and whereabouts of the animals. 
Especially since some animals are sent away on loan each year to other facilities, this information is important to knowing 
the location and identification of animals that are away. A current inventory with all required information must be 
maintained for animals on hand, any offspring born on premises, and animals sold, transferred, or dead.  
 
***Correct by 1-22-24. 
2.134 
   
Contingency planning. 
The licensee is lacking a written contingency plan that was required to be in place by July 5, 2022. Exhibitors must 
develop, document, and follow an appropriate plan to provide for the humane handling, treatment, transportation, housing 
and care of their animals in the event of an emergency or disaster. The contingency plan must identify emergency 
situations one could reasonable expect in the area, outline specific tasks to be carried out, identify a chain or command, 
and address how response and recovery will be handled. Not having a written plan in place could cause delay of critical 
help for the for the animals and could negatively affect their health and well-being in the case of an emergency or 
disaster.  
 
***Correct by 1-22-24. 
3.154 
   
Environment enhancement to promote psychological well-being. 
The licensee is missing a completed and approved environmental enrichment plan for the birds on premises. They have a 
number of varieties of species of poultry, as well as exotics, and indoor pet birds. Social grouping is being considered and 
proper environmental enrichment is being provided to the birds, but the facility lacks a written plan that is approved by the 
attending veterinarian. The plan should include all required components including: social grouping, environmental 
enrichment, special considerations, restraint devices and exemptions. A species appropriate plan for environmental

enhancement is necessary to promote the psychological well-being of birds. 
 
***Correct by 1-22-24 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the facility representative.
